Panjiva is a data-focused technology company that uses machine learning and NLP to extract insights from supply chain data. This unstructured data describes the behavior of millions of real-world entities such as companies, products, and ports, that make up international trade in goods across borders. Our technology and expertise allow us to extract and link these entities from our database of billions of individual records. This data feeds the Panjiva platform, through which we provide powerful search, analysis, and visualization capabilities to our customers.      Panjiva’s data helps power the decisions of our thousands of clients, including Fortune 500 companies, hedge funds, and logistics providers, in addition to universities, government agencies, and NGOs. Ultimately, our team is highly driven to help our thousands of customers better understand the complex and constantly changing global supply chain.      We are seeking a talented full stack engineer to join our team. Successful Panjiva engineers are self-driven and embrace all aspects of product development, from domain research and conversations with customers to discussions on architecture and full-stack development. Working in collaboration with design and engineering teammates, help us continue to build the best search/analytics platform on top of the world’s largest supply chain graph to provide customers with unique and valuable insights. You’ll collaborate with a variety of teams across the company, including data analysis, data engineering, data science, product, and commercial, in unlocking value from our data.      As a full stack engineer at Panjiva, your responsibilities will include:   Ruby on Rails application product development   React/Javascript development   Building new customer facing products and internal tools   Writing and maintaining QA testing features and framework   Database and application performance tuning and improvements   Working closely with integration into the broader S&P CapitalIQ Pro platform      Qualifications   B.S., M.S. or Ph.D. in Computer Science or related field, or equivalent work experience   5+ years of relevant software development experience   Solid engineering skills and strong CS fundamentals (common data structures, algorithms, performance profiling, etc.)   Substantial experience building scalable database-backed web applications in a production environment   Strong coding skills in a dynamic language   Basic understanding of relational databases and SQL   Performance engineering experience (e.g., profiling slow code, understanding complicated query plans and queries based on them, etc.)   Ability to create robust user interfaces with HTML, CSS, and JavaScript, and leverage related tools (dependency management, CSS preprocessors, etc.)   Solid understanding of the web stack (HTTP, headers, cookies, cross-domain restrictions, asset loading, caching)   Ability to lead all aspects of product development, from brainstorming and design to execution and deployment. Comfort wearing many hats.   Advanced SQL knowledge   Solid knowledge of Unix/Linux      Nice-to-Haves   Comfort with software development standard practices, including version control, unit testing, and code review   Fluency in Ruby, Javascript and/or React   Familiarity with Postgres and Elastic Search   Domain knowledge and/or interest in international economics and trade      S&P Global states that the anticipated base salary range for this position is $83,200 to $190,100 . Base salary ranges may vary by geographic location.   In addition to base compensation, this role is eligible for an annual incentive plan.      This role is eligible to receive additional S&P Global benefits. For more information on the benefits we provide to our employees, visit https://www.spgbenefitessentials.com/newhires . Systems Programmer IV           Institute for Precision Medicine - Pennsylvania-Pittsburgh - (22001672)              The Institute for Precision Medicine is seeking a Principal Bioinformatics Scientist (Systems/Programmer V) to lead analyses and interpretation of large high throughput biological datasets including but not limited to, expression, micro RNA, SNP, methylation and Next Gen sequencing technologies. The incumbent will carry out independent computational research projects involving method development, novel algorithm design, in-depth data analysis and integration of lab-generated and publicly available datasets. The incumbent will also work significantly with trainees, mentoring them in data analyses and interpretation as well as have supervisory responsibilities of computational team members within the IPM. The incumbent will additionally collaborate with biomedical researchers across Pitt and UPMC, as well as national consortia in large clinical-genomic data sharing, proteomics, imaging, bioinformatics and related disciplines and assume primary responsibility for providing bioinformatics solutions for translational research. Responsibilities will include but are not limited to data wrangling and sharing, statistical analysis, algorithm development, interpretation of results, software development including data portals, mentoring trainees, assisting with publications and grant proposals. Incumbent will also be responsible for communicating results to collaborating investigators in a timely manner and for working on multiple projects. The incumbent must be able to multitask, develop priorities, work in a fast-paced collaborative environment and adapt to changing needs.                         Masters degree required. Five years of related experience in bioinformatics software development and/or large data systems data mining and analysis, and in-depth understanding of genomics and transcriptomics. Experience working with complex biological datasets is required, as is fluency with basic statistical methods and preferably machine learning.Strong background in bioinformatics, computer science, biology or related discipline. Incumbent must have experience with computational analysis frameworks such as R or Python, and experience with major public genomic databases such as dbGAP, cBIO, GenBank, UniGene, Ensembl, Entrez and UCSC genome browser. Familiarity with bioinformatics tools like Bioconductor and Cytoscape is a bonus. Incumbent must have programming experience with Unix Shell scripting, and UNIX cluster use for high performance computing. A successful candidate will have demonstrated success in scientific creativity, collaboration, and independent work.          The University of Pittsburgh is an Affirmative Action/Equal Opportunity Employer and values equality of opportunity, human dignity and diversity. job_title: Senior Principal Modeling & Simulation Engineer – Autonomous Vehicle Applications
job_Description: At Oshkosh, we build, serve and protect people and communities around the world by designing and manufacturing some of the toughest specialty trucks and access equipment. We employ over 15,000 team members all united by a common purpose. Our engineering and product innovation help keep soldiers and firefighters safe, is critical in building and keeping communities clean and helps people do their jobs every day.        ABOUT THE ROLE     As a Senior Principal Vehicle Simulation Engineer you will work within the Unmanned Systems Engineering team on the design, development and implementation of software architecture, real-time control algorithms, artificial intelligence, motion planning, computer vision and sensor processing algorithms, graphical user interfaces, and inter-process messaging for advanced driver assistance systems (ADAS), connected and autonomous vehicles (CAV)        HOW YOU WILL MAKE A DIFFERENCE     As a Senior Principal Vehicle Simulation Engineer, you will be on an interdisciplinary team conducting research, development, and technical assistance in support of advanced autonomous development. To complement and focus in-field autonomous vehicle testing, your role will be to leverage your experience in modelling and simulation to provide a basis for autonomous vehicle experimentation. Tasks include analyzing modern driverless vehicle technologies, including vision-based 3D mapping and traffic path planning, to evaluate and characterize performance. Design testable cases for autonomous vehicles, integrate solutions, and pursue algorithm design to improve safety and advance autonomous vehicle operation        WHAT YOU NEED         Bachelor’s degree in Mechanical, Electrical, or Computer Engineering or Robotics      Experience with developing in simulation environments, including Gazebo, AirSim, Unreal Engine, or Unity      Experience with Robot Operating System (ROS)      Experience with MATLAB/Simulink, C++, or Python      Ability to interact directly with clients to identify problems, analyze data, generate solutions, and communicate results      Interest and passion to research and develop mobile autonomous systems      Knowledge in vehicle dynamics           HOW TO STAND OUT         MS degree in Mechanical, Electrical, or Computer Engineering or Robotics-related field preferred; PhD degree in Mechanical, Electrical, or Computer Engineering or Robotics-related field a plus      Experience with robotic sensing methods, including 2D/3D lidar, stereo cameras, or structured light      Experience with sensor fusion or feature-based navigation methods      Knowledge of industry best practices in self-driving/autonomous vehicles      Knowledge of Machine Learning techniques for autonomy or perception      Knowledge of Statistical/Performance Analysis           Oshkosh is committed to working with and offering reasonable accommodation to job applicants with disabilities. If you need assistance or an accommodation due to disability for any part of the employment process, please contact us at:  920-502-3009  or corporatetalentacquisition@oshkoshcorp.com.        Oshkosh Corporation is an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer. This company will provide equal opportunity to all individuals without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or veteran status. Information collected regarding categories as provided by law will in no way affect the decision regarding an employment application.        Oshkosh Corporation will not discharge or in any manner discriminate against employees or applicants because they have inquired about, discussed, or disclosed their own pay or the pay of another employee or applicant. However, employees who have access to the compensation information of other employees or applicants as a part of their essential job functions cannot disclose the pay of other employees or applicants to individuals who do not otherwise have access to compensation information, unless the disclosure is (a) in response to a formal complaint or charge, (b) in furtherance of an investigation, proceeding, hearing, or action, including an investigation conducted by the employer, or (c) consistent with Oshkosh Corporation's legal duty to furnish information. Company Info  Teva is a global pharmaceutical leader and the world's largest generic medicines producer, committed to improving health and increasing access to quality health solutions worldwide. Our employees are at the core of our success, with colleagues in over 80 countries delivering the world's largest medicine cabinet to 200 million people every day. We offer a uniquely diverse portfolio of products and solutions for patients and we've built a promising pipeline centered around our core therapeutic areas. We are continually developing patient-centric solutions and significantly growing both our generic and specialty medicines business through investment in research and development, marketing, business development and innovation. This is how we improve health and enable people to live better, healthier lives. Join us on our journey of growth! Job Description  This position is in the Clinical and Real World Evidence (RWE) Statistics organization that is part of Teva Specialty R&D with innovative and diverse pipeline including neuroscience, immunology, oncology and other therapeutic areas. Reporting to the RWE Statistics group head, the primary responsibility for this role is to provide statistical leadership and expertise for non-interventional studies and RWE-related research in all phases of drug-development including lifecycle management. The responsibility for this role includes ensuring technical rigor and creative analytic techniques to solve complex statistical problems in analyzing data from non-interventional studies and large real world databases. The individual in this role will provide quantitative insights and statistical leadership in product strategy, product defense, design and analysis of non-interventional studies including protocol development, statistical analysis plans, and other regulatory submission documents. The individual in this role will need to communicate statistical concepts effectively to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.   Responsibilities:   Provide strategic statistical leadership and quantitative insights, including innovative techniques on design and analysis of non-interventional studies and medical-evidence generation including the use of RWE data sources.  Collaborate effectively with stakeholders including but not limited to Medical Affairs, HEOR/Epidemiology, Clinical Development, Regulatory Affairs and Commercial to develop strategy around evidence-generation, product lifecycle management, product defense and publications  Responsibilities include collaboration with cross-functional teams on the design of observational studies, clinical trials with synthetic controls, contributing to protocol development, authoring statistical analysis plans and analysis and interpretation or study data.  Promote and implement innovations in statistical methodology and ensure technical rigor in the design and analyses of observational research including the use of large real-world datasets, predictive modeling and machine learning techniques.  Utilize various data sources including RWE databases (e.g. claims, EHR, registries) and clinical data on state-of-the-art cloud-based Big Data computing platform. KCF Technologies is an exciting and rapidly growing technology company dedicated to putting innovative solutions to work in the Industrial World. SmartDiagnostics, our IIOT Technology, fuels our mission to solve the world's machine health problems to drive safety and sustainability for our communities. To accomplish this epic technical revolution, we integrate our core values into our everyday actions and consistently challenge the status quo! Learn more at www.kcftech.com.  At KCF, we value autonomy, working smart, and doing things a little bit differently. If you're an A-player who wants to be part of one of the most important companies revitalizing machine health across the world, KCF is the place for you. If our values resonate with you, please keep reading!  Core Values:  Smarts: We are humbly aggressive lifelong learners.  Grit: We are scrappy, proactive problem solvers who don't stop until the job is done.  Drive: We demonstrate an insatiable hunger to serve others.  Responsibility: We do the right thing and contribute to the greater good.  Autonomy: We own our work and define how we do it, while aligned with the greater mission. Where You Come In:  KCF Technologies is looking for a talented and motivated  Data Analytics Engineer  to help develop computer algorithms and models trained to ingest sensor and machine process data and diagnose fault conditions, prognose time-to-failure, provide recommended actions, and perform root-cause analysis.  We are looking for an individual who not only has an aptitude for data analytics, statistical analysis, and pattern recognition, but also has a passion for learning and understanding how things work. You consider yourself to be independently motivated and an analytically deductive problem solver, with a factual and to-the-point communication style. You're a case matter expert on things that draw your interest, in addition to being extremely disciplined with perfectionist tendencies.  Our ideal candidate exemplifies our cultural values of Smarts, Grit, and Drive, and considers him or herself to be:   Self-motivated  Passionate for solving real-world problems  Hard-working  Adaptable  Detail-oriented  Accepting of the unknown   If this sounds like you, we encourage you to keep reading!   Essential Functions:   Design and implement algorithms tailored to industrial machine health diagnostics, prognostics, and root-cause analysis  Produce models for edge and/or cloud (AWS) execution  Integrate analytics solutions within the KCF SMARTdiagnostics platform  Construct data mining tools for acquiring training and validation data sets   Qualifications:   Bachelor's degree in Computational Science; Statistics; Computer, Mechanical, or Industrial Engineering; or similar field of study  Strong mathematical background (linear algebra, calculus, probability and statistics)  Machine Learning experience (regression and classification, supervised, and unsupervised learning)  At least 2 years of experience in machine health Strong algorithm design skills  Programming experience with Python (Numpy, Scipy, Scikit-Learn, Matplotlib, TensorFlow, etc.), MATLAB, R, or similar languages  Communicates verbally and in writing in a clear and professional manner  Able to work in a rapid-paced environment, managing and tracking multiple tasks with speed and accuracy  Highly service-oriented disposition with aptitude in problem-solving  Must exemplify the following KCF cultural values: Smarts, Grit, Drive  Strong organizational, time management, and prioritization abilities  Should be able to deal with difficult, sensitive, and confidential issues  Perks & Benefits:  At KCF, we are committed to providing best-in-class benefits, engaging development opportunities, and powerful perks that are focused on bringing out the best in you.  Full-time benefits are as follows:   100% company-paid Medical, Dental, and Vision premiums  Health Savings Account with a generous annual employer contribution  Hybrid work model for most positions, "work from home, work from anywhere"  Competitive compensation & bonus opportunities  Four weeks PTO; Paid Holidays  401(k) with KCF match  Wellness Perk- including annual reimbursement program  Monthly cell and office expense stipend  Learning Culture committed to growth and continuous development   At KCF, we are an equal opportunity employer. The only things we require for employment, compensation, advancement and benefits are performance and a good team attitude. No one will be denied opportunities or benefits, and no employment decisions will be made, on the basis of race, religion/creed, national origin, ancestry, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, age, disability that does not prohibit performance of essential job functions, protected veteran status, medical condition, marital status, pregnancy, genetic information, possession of a general education development certificate ("GED") as compared to a high school diploma, or any other characteristic protected by applicable federal or state laws. KCF complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location in which KCF has facilities.

Overview         In today's world, customers expect companies to know who they are and what they want. Customers want to have products, services or experiences that best suit their needs delivered to them seamlessly across physical and digital channels.        Customers are human first: driven by dynamic wants, needs, and desires. The ability for brands to make personal, meaningful connections on a human level has never been greater and Hux by Deloitte Digital delivers on those experiences in a way that allows companies to own the customer journey end to end.         Hux is the Human Experience Platform by Deloitte Digital. We help companies connect key data sources to understand what matters most to people; connect to advanced technologies like AI and machine learning to sense and respond to those needs at scale; and connect their systems to unlock insights, create collaboration and drive acquisition, engagement and loyalty. Most importantly, we empower companies to connect with customers in personal, meaningful ways that respect them as people, not just customers.        Hux by Deloitte Digital gives companies the ability to build and leverage the connections - between people, systems, data and technologies - so they can deliver personalized, contextual experiences to customers at scale.           Work You'll Do         The    Product Specialist - Customer Data Management  will help lead the vision and build of a suite of capabilities at the core of our end-to-end solution. You will focus on building out the core information architecture as it fuels a multitude of decisioning models and omni-channel customer experiences. Hux tightly integrates marketing managed services with pre-built IP/software and a best-of-breed ecosystem to power real-time data management, marketing decisioning support, content, delivery, personalization, audience management and the end-to-end customer experience (CX) spectrum.        As Product Specialist, you will engage with the cross-functional product, program management and engineering teams in leading comprehensive ongoing releases of enhanced capabilities and new solutions to market. You will be responsible for end-to-end delivery of application technology solutions in line with strategic business objectives. You will ensure that the business needs are clearly understood, and the technology implemented meets the needs and expectations of the business. You will be responsible to guide cross functional teams to deliver innovative products at market speed using Agile/Scrum principles. You will facilitate scrum ceremonies such as release planning, sprint planning, daily scrums, sprint demo, sprint review and retrospectives.        You will support the following:            Work with business stakeholders to prioritize planned and unplanned development engagements      Work with the go-to-market team on launch and customer adoption, support early customer programs, and work with engineering teams on user interface, architecture, and integration with other products in the portfolio      You will populate, review and refine product backlogs, including, but not limited to, platform themes, epics, features, user stories, business validation and user acceptance test plans and scripts      Prepare, review, and refine project plans in partnership teams across the spectrum of groups involved in platform development and deployment      Facilitate scrum ceremonies such as release planning, sprint planning, daily scrums, sprint demo, sprint review and retrospectives            What You'll Bring to the Table         Qualifications        Required:            Bachelor's degree required. Technical fields such as Computer Science, Engineering, Math or Physics majors preferred. MBA a plus      3+ years in product management, with experience in the Digital and Customer Experience (CX)      Industry knowledge and experience with Customer Data Platforms (CDPs)      Experience in the Digital Marketing domains and an understanding of Mar-Tech and Ad-Tech      3+ years in Cloud-based data warehouses / data lakes (Snowflake, Databricks) to power AI/ML      Understanding of artificial intelligence / machine learning paradigms      Demonstrated ability to think strategically and translate plans into phased actions      Demonstrated experience in Agile Scrum development methodologies      Understanding and responsibility in project and program management principles, with experience in the application of these principles to developing marketing technology solutions      Effective oral, written and interpersonal communication skills. Strong presentation skills necessary to communicate, and persuade, a wide range of audiences      Demonstrated ability to partner and collaborate across organizations to optimize outcomes      Has experience with scaled systems and understands data and system integration; should also have a good understanding of security from a data and process perspective      Has a customer-driven mindset and insatiable appetite for engineering excellence and drive for outcomes      Minimal travel may be required      Limited immigration sponsorship may be available        Preferred:            Experience building data models to support artificial intelligence / machine learning solutions      Strong knowledge of cloud platforms (AWS/GCP/Azure)      Experience with big data frameworks (Spark, etc.)      Experience data pipelines & information architecture      Knowledge of distributed systems      Experience with leading Mar-Tech / Ad-Tech providers        #Product22         AHBV

Customer Experience (CX) Data Analyst      Evoke is a marketing and advertising agency servicing the healthcare industry. We partner with leading pharmaceutical, biotech, and medical device clients, consistently delivering unparalleled levels of strategic, creative, and technological innovation that build richer and more effective interactions between our clients and their customers.      The Importance of CX & Data Analytics      CX is a customers' holistic perception of their experience of a brand. This perception is made up by every interaction a customer has with the brand, from navigating the website, to making a purchase, to engaging with customer service, and even to the delivery of the product itself.      At Evoke, we believe that in order to fundamentally make health more human, we have to understand the CX. We have to understand the journeys of each core customer, looking for moments of friction, moments of frustration or moments where expectations are not met. By revealing these experiences, we are able to understand where to step in and create solutions that are truly meaningful, are often unique to a category, and ultimately create a seamless CX.      Evoke is proud to have embraced the power of Big Data as a crucial mechanism to help us understand consumer attitudes, behaviors, and expectations. The macro data enables us to substantiate findings in the CX as well as generate new ways to understand human behavior.      To help us accomplish this we are looking to add a full-time CX Data Analyst to the team here at Evoke. The ideal hire should have strong skills across all aspects of data analytics and research, including mining, cleaning, clustering, analysis, and visualization. The candidate should also showcase ease of conveying complex data into readable, goal-oriented outputs.      Job Description      At Evoke, the CX Data Analyst anchors the research to a scientific methodology, but continuously creates new ways to analyze the data. The role is not a copy-paste-print-present type of position, where the same report needs to be refreshed every quarter. Instead, the Evoke CX Data Analyst is challenged with Journey Mapping, Voice of Customer Analysis, Key Business Questions (KBQs), Audience Behavior, and much more. It's this versatile breath of analysis that requires someone who's willing to continuously explore, experiment, and learn, yet deliver a project on time while taking ownership.      The CX Data Analyst would predominantly be working with text-based data, analyzing hundreds of thousands of data points to arrive at linguistic findings. These insights will often align against KBQs provided by CX Strategy and other team-members. Therefore, the CX Data Analyst needs to have a strong collaborative nature and enjoy teaming up on projects so that it may reach its full potential. The CX Data Analyst should always want to go "one level deeper" asking "Why did the consumer do that?" or "Why does the consumer thing this?"      The CX Data Analyst will join a small team that has experienced strong growth providing research and solutions across a broad range of therapeutic areas and disease states.      Specific duties include:          Work directly with other team-members (most often CX Strategy) to conduct Linguistic Analysis and NLP Research across Journey Mapping, Voice of Customer Analysis, Competitive Gap Analysis, Search Behavior Summary Social Media Listening, New Business Pitch Support etc.      Execute data mining, identifying optimal data sources, extracting data, connect to APIs or building data scrapers      Execute data cleaning, understanding best practices, and leverage Python to pre-processes for analysis      Execute data clustering across different data sources to combine a more robust dataset      Execute data clustering against specific rules to establish relevant subsets of data      Execute data analysis using several research techniques with a focus on NLP (examples below):            Top volume across clustered search terms        Top volume across topics/terms/n-grams/sentiment/emojis used on social        Top sources of influence across channels, forums, blogs, news, SERP, accounts, products etc.        Longitudinal content relevance        Audience language analysis           Execute data visualization across Excel and Python leveraging packages such as Seaborn, matplotlib, Plotly, Bokeh or others      Craft a story from the data, conveying complex insights in simple visuals and communicate the takeaways with ease      Help develop new research offerings and outside the box solutions for both internal and external purposes      Continuously consider automation and optimization across current research streams and projects      Keep current on best practices for data analytics; emerging trends, channels, technologies, platforms, and partners; and innovative programs and approaches         Skills / Qualifications:          2+ years in data analytics, specifically working with text-based data (search, social, reviews, news, transcripts, white papers, articles, excerpts etc.)      1+ years of agency experience preferred, but not required      Healthcare/pharmaceutical marketing preferred, but not required      Python proficiency required      Experience mining, cleansing, clustering, analyzing and visualizing data      Hands-on experience with web analytics platforms, social media listening tools, and search tools such as NetBase, Quid, Crimson Hexagon, Google Keyword Planner, SEMRush, GA etc.      Excellent written communication, verbal communication, and presentation skills      Proficiency in Microsoft Office, Excel, Word, PPT etc.      Willingness to learn new tools, code and software      Must be willing to travel up to 10%      BA/BS Degree (preferably in Computer Science, Economics, Statistics or Business Administration)      Demonstrate skills in adaptability, attention to detail, problem-solving, decision making, customer service, interpersonal relations, problem solving, project management, quality management, teamwork, presentations, results oriented, strategic thinker and team building         Additional Skills/Qualifications (Not Required but Highly Valuable):          Data analysis and research experience with:            Call Center Data        SEO/SEM        Scattertext        Topic Modeling (LDA)        CX Journey Mapping        Statistical & Predictive Modeling        GPT-3 or Neural Networks (RNN)        AI/ML image & video recognition        AI/ML classification best practices        SQL        Tableau

Meta is seeking a Research Scientist to join Meta AI’s Responsible AI Fairness Team. Individuals in this role are expected to be recognized experts in identified research areas such as measuring bias, quantitative social science methods, ethics governance, artificial intelligence, machine learning, artificial intelligence ethics. The ideal candidate will have a keen interest in producing new science to understand fairness of scaled labeling and ML-supported systems. The ideal candidate will also be a thought-leader in the AI ethics, law, and policy and engage with teams around the company to help develop their own technologies, practices, and processes in the space.    Research Scientist, Responsible AI Fairness (PhD) Responsibilities:  Perform research to advance the science, technology, and understanding of ethical machine learning and machine-learning-supported systems. Design scalable solutions for measuring and mitigating systems at Meta scope. Work towards long-term ambitious research goals, while identifying intermediate milestones. Influence progress of relevant research communities by producing publications. Contribute research that can be applied to Meta product development. Engage with product, legal, and policy teams to help them develop informed approaches to AI ethics.    Minimum Qualifications:  Currently has or is in the process of obtaining a PhD degree in the field of Machine Learning, AI, AI Ethics, a Social Science, a related field, or equivalent practical experience. Degree must be completed prior to joining Meta. Experience manipulating and analyzing data from different sources. Experience working with ML systems to diagnose and mitigate issues. Experience in theoretical and empirical research and for answering questions with research. Must obtain work authorization in country of employment at the time of hire, and maintain ongoing work authorization during employment.    Preferred Qualifications:  Experience building systems based on machine learning, data analysis to measure the fairness of labeling or data-collection systems, and/or deep learning methods. Research and software engineer experience demonstrated via an internship, work experience, coding competitions, or open-source contributions. Knowledge in Python, R, SQL, and/or another programming language. Proven track record of achieving results as demonstrated by fellowships, patents, or publications. Experience solving complex problems and comparing alternative solutions, tradeoffs, and diverse points of view to determine a path forward. Experience working and communicating cross functionally in a team environment.     Facebook is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, transgender status, sexual stereotypes, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics. We also consider qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with applicable federal, state and local law.Facebook is committed to providing reasonable accommodations for candidates with disabilities in our recruiting process. If you need any assistance or accommodations due to a disability, please let us know at accommodations-ext@fb.com.

Position summary         Do you thrive on developing creative and innovative insights to solve complex challenges? Want to work on next-generation, cutting edge products and services that deliver outstanding value and that are global in vision and scope? Work with premier thought leaders in your field? Work for a world-class organization that provides an exceptional career experience with an inclusive and collaborative culture?           Work you'll do         As a Technology Risk & Compliance Manager , you will be responsible for implementing and monitoring risk and control considerations in the Deloitte Audit technology organization to effectively identify regulatory, legal and compliance risk exposures, with a focus on quality, data protection and security matters, related to our innovative products and solutions, environments and frameworks at all stages with the software development lifecycle (e.g. application design, development and deployment). This exciting and challenging role invites you to drive quality as part of the software development lifecycle (SDLC), initiate consultations with stakeholder groups, ideate on ways to creatively solve problems and escalate issues as necessary to Technology Controls Leadership.        Under the guidance and supervision of a Senior Manager, you will drive quality of our technology products using established risk and control frameworks (such as SOX, Security, Privacy, Confidentiality, Third Party or SOC/ISAE) to ensure that development, hosting, deployment and other risk decisions comply with existing firm policies, professional standards, laws and regulations and other internal and external requirements. You will collaborate with various groups (e.g., internal IT organization, Deloitte's vendors and IT service providers) and will be required to understand their roles and responsibilities in the overall IT control structure. Further, you will perform product risk assessments and prepare confidential information management plans. As a Technology Risk & Compliance Manager, you will be involved in all aspects of the SDLC, from participation in product increment/sprint planning sessions and understanding user stores, to reviewing product testing, reviewing control testing and ensuring that the proper risk mitigation activities are properly designed and implemented and operating effectively.           Qualifications            Required:             Bachelor's or Master's degree in Accounting, Accounting Information Systems, or other related degree.      Licensed CPA or CISA      Minimum of 4-5 years of experience in audit or risk assurance      Strong technical or audit knowledge and the ability to apply this knowledge to the design, development and deployment of applications based upon TRC requirements      Very strong knowledge and understanding of, or the ability to learn, the regulatory requirements and professional standards involving the development, documentation, review, retention and archiving of evidence, including reproduction thereof for professional, legal or regulatory purposes.      Ability to apply concepts of risk assessment and professional skepticism.      Ability to challenge the status quo, and to identify untapped opportunities, alternate approaches, and creative solutions to audit products and solutions      Reasonable familiarity with audit or other regulatory technology applications.      Ensure key deliverables (control testing, evaluation of test results, other items as requested, etc.) adhere to high quality standards      Familiarity with data analytics and/or technology fueled by machine learning/AI.      Strong project management skills to keep multiple projects organized and deliver results under tight, demanding deadlines for a high volume of products and releases while maintaining high-quality and precision.      Strong verbal and written communication skills.      Proactive approach and anticipation of potential challenges.      Work in cross-functional environments with professionals across Deloitte (non-auditors) and various geographic locations.            Preferred:             Privacy regulation experience      Data quality and risk experience            The team         Our audits are fueled by more than just technology - what really sets us apart are our insightful professionals, collaborative culture, and commitment to innovation and continuous improvement. Our audit professionals apply a streamlined, intelligent approach to the audit, enabled by innovative tools and technologies. Quality is our top priority, and by focusing on innovation, we continue to raise the bar on quality and deliver greater value to our clients. Learn more about Deloitte Audit.

Fraud Detection Analyst  At Radial, our employees are the forefront of ecommerce, bringing beloved brands to consumers through our fulfillment, customer care and technology solutions. We are fueling the future of retail, which means you are, too. When you work for Radial, you join a global community of changemakers, where the work is critical, and the culture is fun. We depend on our workforce to overcome real-world challenges every day and encourage you to carve your own career path while shaping our future together.  Radial, the leader in omnichannel commerce technologies and operations has an exciting opening for a Fraud Detection Analyst. Radial’s omnichannel solutions use cutting-edge technology and analytics to optimize the e-commerce end to end processes reducing costs for our customer while enhancing the consumer experience.   Role Summary:  The Fraud Detection Analyst will be responsible for identifying new and unique ways of finding and capturing ecommerce fraud trends. This role is a terrific opportunity to work in the dynamic space of e-commerce fraud to solve complex problems using big data technologies. This role will work alongside a team of analysts and data scientists. The department uses a wide variety of systems, tools and algorithms to evaluate data, execute their investigation and develop an efficient analytical workflow including machine learning models, velocity detection and behavior analytics.   Responsibilities:   Work all existing Fraud Detection and Analytics reports & processes  Accurate and timely linking of all confirmed fraud  Accurate and effective blocking of negative information  Analyze and develop new effective Fraud Detection and Analytics processes & systems  Reduce out sort rates and increase fraud prevented  Improve the efficiency of blocked data and fraud identification processes  Improve the block process and reduce impact to sales as a result of bad blocks  Identify and remediate customer experience opportunities  Provide actionable feedback to the rules team to help reduce queue volumes  Focus on improving overall operational effectiveness; specifically in helping to manage queue volumes, improved fraud detection & prevention and significantly improve customer experience  Be accountable for and own your processes and actively find ways to improve the entire team  Increase reject rate via effective fraud detection and efficient prevention mechanisms  Effectively communicate with all levels of the business as well as external clients and customers, including law enforcement  Actively participate in the identification and prevention of ecommerce related fraud activity and financial loss  Analyze and identify links between fraudulent transactions to identify and stop fraud rings  Minimize fraud loss and be an example to the review team  Help create a well-rounded team that understands multiple facets of Fraud Management Solutions  Any and all other possible assigned responsibilities   Qualifications:   Must be a consistent, above average performer as supported by the analysts scorecard data  Demonstrate a high level of initiative  Must have the ability to facilitate group processes  Must be a team player and must be able to communicate with different levels of management  Strong analytical skills  Exception attention to detail  Must be organized and able to prioritize work  Proficient with Microsoft Excel  Willingness and flexibility to work all shifts including weekends and overtime  Proven ability to handle all assigned tasks and responsibilities  Ability to accept and embrace changed conditions   Desired Qualifications:   Bachelor’s degree in a relevant field such as business, criminal justice, finance or economics  Direct experience with ecommerce payment fraud prevention operations  Direct experience with the processing of chargebacks, billing disputes and/or judgmental lending  Knowledge of or experience with Oracle and/or SQL as well as Excel/Access/PowerPoint   Travel: This position is not remote. Travel is not required.   Radial is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations, and ordinances.   Radial is committed to ensuring that its online application process provides an equal employment opportunity to all job seekers, including individuals with disabilities. If you believe you need a reasonable accommodation in order to search for a job opening or to submit an application, please contact us by emailing  hroperations@radial.com . We will work to assist disabled job seekers whose disability prevents them from being able to apply online.   We were made aware of an employment scam in which a third-party is creating false communications under the Radial name. We want to reiterate that Radial never seeks payment from job applicants and only reaches out from @radial.com email addresses. We are encouraging applicants to apply through our website at  Radial Careers  for added security.

job_title: IT Product Manager - Modelling and Simulation
job_Description: Job Description        New hires in office-based roles in the U.S. & Puerto Rico will be required, subject to applicable law, to demonstrate that they have been fully vaccinated for COVID-19 or qualify for a medical or religious exemption to this vaccination requirement that can be accommodated without an undue burden to the operation. However, subject to applicable law, employees working in roles that the Company determines require routine partnership with external stakeholders, such as employees in health services, customer facing commercial, or research based roles, will be required to be fully vaccinated as a condition of employment.        Our IT team operates as a business partner proposing ideas and innovative solutions that enable new organizational capabilities. We partner internationally to deliver the services and solutions that help everyone to be more productive and enable innovation.        The Product Manager for Modeling and Simulation Products will be part of the Scientific data consumption product team. The Product Manager is accountable for the ultimate success of the whole product experience including build, deployment, and user education, combined with communications, product positioning, and managing the expectations of stakeholders. In this role, they will work with other product managers, technical teams, SMEs and stakeholders.        The Product Manager needs a deep knowledge of users and the business, primarily how the business works and how it measures value. The Product Manager will drive and measure how the product is positioned, utilized, and generates value, and what are the various costs and considerations of maintaining and supporting the products. This means comprehending the priorities of various stakeholders, the dynamics of the ecosystem the products operate in, and the economics of the products.        The Scientific Data Consumption Product Line (SDC) provides a combination of technology, infrastructure, software, and personnel to support large scale scientific data consumption and computing comprising of the Scientific Data Platform, Modeling and Machine Learning Platforms, High Performance Computing (HPC) workflows, and “experience” products such as visualization, modeling workbenches, and analytics development environments.        Education Minimum:         B.Sc. or higher in scientific domain or computer sciences           Prerequisites:         Minimum 5-10 years working with customers to define requirements, preferably in the sciences/pharmaceutical industry      Proven experience overseeing all elements of product development lifecycle, including developing and maintaining detailed project plans from discovery/UX to delivery      Identify and define business problems, and translate into actionable requirements and tasks      Demonstrate analytical problem-solving skills      Excellent written and verbal communications skills      Effectively engage both technical and non-technical stakeholders and users      Be able to work independently, anticipating and resolving problems      Has managed multiple complex experience design and development projects simultaneously           Preferred:         Domain knowledge or familiarity with Machine Learning Platforms (e.g. Sagemaker and DataBricks)      Pharmaceutical modeling and simulation in chemistry, pharmacometrics (pk/pd), and data sciences      Pharmaceutical drug discovery and pre-clinical development experience      Has worked in Agile software development      Familiarity with Cloud based software and terms           Primary Tasks:     Product Manager: Key Tasks         Develop and maintain a high level of technical product knowledge and specific domain expertise.      Defines the product vision, strategy and roadmap.      Act as the product’s chief advocate within the wider company.      Is a user expert and appreciates the reasons customers use their products.      Can justify new products or improvements to existing products in a value focused manner (e.g. Business Case, ROI etc)      Defines what to solve by articulating the value of problems to be solved, along with priorities and justification for each part of the solution.      Gathers, manages, and prioritizes product requirements* that detail user problems and needs, technical constraints and strategic objectives.      Develops positioning and communication messages for the product and influences training and other change related activities.      Acts as the customer champion articulating and advocating the user’s needs           Product Manager Tasks: Key Deliverables         High level product vision and OKRs      Problem statements and requirements      Product roadmaps      Product comparisons, assessments and artifacts for use by a development team      Communication materials conveying the above content      Analysis and evidence to document and communicate the data used to make product decisions      Marketing materials regarding the value and positioning of their product      Value justification evidence e.g. Business case, ROI calculations, impact assessment           Product Manager: Key behaviors         Demonstrate a high level of agency/growth mindset      Influence others without direct authority      Transparency with respect to your prioritization and roadmap process      Ability to say “no,” but explain why in terms that stakeholders understand      Ruthless prioritization while balancing the needs of customers and stakeholders      Ability to bring evidence-based decision-making to your communication      Empowerment of your team to make their own decisions      Show resilience and restraint when receiving feedback about the product      Work in a sustainable manner and encourage this behavior in others           Our Support Functions deliver services and make recommendations about ways to enhance our workplace and the culture of our organization. Our Support Functions include Human Resources, Finance, Information Technology, Legal, Procurement, Administration, Facilities and Security.        Who we are …     We are known as Merck & Co., Inc., Kenilworth, New Jersey, USA in the United States and Canada and MSD everywhere else. For more than a century, we have been inventing for life, bringing forward medicines and vaccines for many of the world's most challenging diseases. Today, our company continues to be at the forefront of research to deliver innovative health solutions and advance the prevention and treatment of diseases that threaten people and animals around the world.        What we look for …     Imagine getting up in the morning for a job as important as helping to save and improve lives around the world. Here, you have that opportunity. You can put your empathy, creativity, digital mastery, or scientific genius to work in collaboration with a diverse group of colleagues who pursue and bring hope to countless people who are battling some of the most challenging diseases of our time. Our team is constantly evolving, so if you are among the intellectually curious, join us—and start making your impact today.        NOTICE FOR INTERNAL APPLICANTS     In accordance with Managers' Policy - Job Posting and Employee Placement, all employees subject to this policy are required to have a minimum of twelve (12) months of service in current position prior to applying for open positions.        If you have been offered a separation benefits package, but have not yet reached your separation date and are offered a position within the salary and geographical parameters as set forth in the Summary Plan Description (SPD) of your separation package, then you are no longer eligible for your separation benefits package. To discuss in more detail, please contact your HRBP or Talent Acquisition Advisor.        US and Puerto Rico Residents Only:        Our company is committed to inclusion, ensuring that candidates can engage in a hiring process that exhibits their true capabilities. Please click here if you need an accommodation during the application or hiring process.        Pay Transparency Nondiscrimination        We are proud to be a company that embraces the value of bringing diverse, talented, and committed people together. The fastest way to breakthrough innovation is when diverse ideas come together in an inclusive environment. We encourage our colleagues to respectfully challenge one another’s thinking and approach problems collectively. We are an equal opportunity employer, committed to fostering an inclusive and diverse workplace.        Search Firm Representatives Please Read Carefully  Merck & Co., Inc., Kenilworth, NJ, USA, also known as Merck Sharp & Dohme Corp., Kenilworth, NJ, USA, does not accept unsolicited assistance from search firms for employment opportunities. All CVs / resumes submitted by search firms to any employee at our company without a valid written search agreement in place for this position will be deemed the sole property of our company. No fee will be paid in the event a candidate is hired by our company as a result of an agency referral where no pre-existing agreement is in place. Where agency agreements are in place, introductions are position specific. Please, no phone calls or emails.
